Item.Item: HP Photosmart Premium C310a e-All-in-One Color Ink-jet - Printer / copier / scanner - Australia, New Zealand
HP Photosmart Premium C310a e-All-in-One Color Ink-jet - Printer / copier / scanner - Australia, New Zealand
Item.Review:
This is a great printer. I forms excellent images for documents as well as photos. It's also fairly fast. I really love the photo tray. It stores a few blank 4x6 cards and uses that tray when you print a photo. No more re-adjusting trays to print photos, it just works.
Network setup was VERY easy and no additional software/bloatware is required for the Mac. Even wireless scanning works perfectly. HP's online documentation was great. If you have a mac, just setup the printer via it's LCD, toss the included bloatware to the side and on the mac in system preferences add your printer. That's it! To scan, use the mac Image Capture program.
Pros: Quick, high quality document and photo prints. The printer is easy to setup and works like it's supposed to. Additional tray for photo ... s! Wireless printing and scanning work perfectly.
Cons: Ink. The included ink will print 2-3 pages or 1 photo at most. An additional set of standard ink will cost you $52 for an advertised 250-300 prints or 18-20 cents per page. XL ink will set you back $107 for an advertised 750-800 prints or 13-14 cents per page. In reality, after less than 2 reams of paper you'll spend as much or more than the printer costs in ink. If you're going to print lots of photographs, don't! Use adorama or some other professional printing service. A one off here or there for family is great, but you'll go broke printing all your photos with this unit.
Other comments: Use the HP ink rewards program advertised on the website. Offer decent discounts over buying from a local office supply store and the discounts are applied instantly. Currently, if you're a member you also get free overnight shipping. If you can afford it, go for the XL cartridges. I purchased a set of the XL ink and ended up saving a bit of money buying from HP. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: HP Photosmart Premium C310a e-All-in-One Color Ink-jet - Printer / copier / scanner - Australia, New Zealand
Item.ReviewTitle: All in all it is a great color quality printer.
Item.Review:
Pros: Easy set up and the touch pad is great! Great price too!
Cons: I would like a better message about low ink and print quality.
I like this updated printer. It prints very good quailty but while i was printing it did not give me a choice to stop printing when the ink was low. My last HP printer stopped printing and asked if I wanted to continue in black. I was printing several prints and it just kept printing and I had to throw away 3 pictures as they came out pink and gray scale. Otherwise it works good. When printing pictures you should not feel this is the final quality. I was upset that they looked very brownish and then the next day, WOW! True colors were there. I almost took it back until I waited and checked the final ink quality the next day. The ink is easy to in ... stall and the wireless set up was easy. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: HP Photosmart Premium C310a e-All-in-One Color Ink-jet - Printer / copier / scanner - Australia, New Zealand
Item.Review:
Pros: Easy To Use; Great Print Quality; Easy To Set Up; Compact Design
Cons: Noisy; Slow Operation
Ink cost too too much. Printing stops when one cartridge runs out of ink while others are available. I tried to change color of text and it still would not print.
Item.HelpfulCount: 1 out of 1 found this review helpful.

Item.Item: HP Photosmart Premium C310a e-All-in-One Color Ink-jet - Printer / copier / scanner - Australia, New Zealand
Item.ReviewTitle: Nice feature, poor documentation and support.
Item.Review: I was concerned after reading many negative reviews when I placed the order. I decided to give it a try as I have a very good deal and I can return it locally if I found any problem. Most people found problem in getting the web service connection and found it very noisy. The setup is also not very smooth if you want to use it solely through wireless. For the web service server connection issue, I solved it by putting the printer's IP in DMZ on my main router. Once I did that, it got web connection immediately. To set up the printer for wireless printing, don't use the CD but download the installation wizard. Otherwise, it asks you to install it through USB port first. Even with the installation wizard, I had problem in detecting the printer in the network during installation. Eventually, m ... y computers at home see the printer one after the other. Perhaps it only allows one detection by one computer at a time during installation. I don't think I can solve the noise issue and I'll have to live with it. I have tested web scan, remote printing of photo and document, wireless network printing, etc; and everything work as described. I also installed a few apps for print coupons and weather forecast. The included Soduku and Dreamwork crafts are cool too. Once you get the web connection working, make sure you update it with the November 2011 release of system software. It did crash once when I was playing with the apps on the touch screen that I need to restart it once. Other than that, it has been working very well and the printing is very fast. I took one star off for the poor documentation and support as well as the difficulty in the initial setup. HP does need more qualified support people as I found the response in the support forum mostly useless. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: HP Photosmart Premium C310a e-All-in-One Color Ink-jet - Printer / copier / scanner - Australia, New Zealand
Item.Review:
Pros: Pretty simple to set up, good price, gift card came with it, amazing photos and features!
Cons: Cord to connect printer and computer NOT included, doesn't scan wirelessly
POSITIVE THOUGHTS: First, I chose this printer because it was discounted for $50, plus I get a $50 gift card with it – oh and I really didn’t need a fax machine. Secondly, delivery was fast - coming on the date specified in the email. One should be mindful that because it is an electronic device and a huge package, I believe it was UPS, will require someone to sign for it. I think that’s good – ensuring a safe delivery. Third, upon opening the box, (maybe because it slipped my mind or I don’t remember seeing it in the description online) it already came with all the ink needed for it. So no need to go ... back in to the nearby stores to find and buy the ink cartridges made for your printer. Fourth, directions in starting the printer and installing the ink cartridges were very simple – and the visual display helped a lot to make sure I was doing it right =). Fifth, setting up the features/settings and new email address of your printer – compared to the coded one HP originally gives you – was a little complicated at first, but eventually I was able to change it to something I would remember. For example to: Of course, that really isn’t the email address of my computer, but you get the point. I am impressed with the quickness of the printer in receiving documents I emailed to it. And scanning documents that are two sided is also VERY easy. Sixth, I wanted to test the statement HP promised for “lab-quality photos” so I inserted blank 4x6 photo paper in the tray, plugged in my memory stick, chose about 2 pictures I wished printed (just in case I felt like I was just wasting photo paper and ink) and voila! Out came the most clear and vibrant photos I’ve ever seen! Literally! It was so much better than those I end up picking up at my local stores – that I felt this printer was an upgrade of theirs like HDTVs are upgrades of the ones I have at home! Hahaha! But, I digress; I am incredibly impressed by all the other features that are available wi ... expand » « collapse

Item.Item: HP Photosmart Premium C310a e-All-in-One Color Ink-jet - Printer / copier / scanner - Australia, New Zealand
Item.Review:
Pros: Smooth, quiet and excellent photo prints.
Cons: Haven't found a thing yet.
I bought this printer when my old HP wore out after 12 years. It's an easy set up and easy to use. I don't use the wireless feature; it's hooked up to my computer but it is an available option. I love the visual ink level option and the print quality is excellent especially for photos. I am extremely happy with this purchase as well as the service and advise that I received from the retailer.

Item.Item: HP Photosmart Premium C310a e-All-in-One Color Ink-jet - Printer / copier / scanner - Australia, New Zealand
Item.Review:
Pros: Price, ease of use
Cons: Scanner cover does not stay up on its own.
I am very impressed with this device. It was very easy to set up and although it came with no operating instructions it was very easy to figure out. The scan feature is wonderful. I scanned an old photo of mine and the scanned document was excellent quality.

Item.Item: HP Photosmart Premium C310a e-All-in-One Color Ink-jet - Printer / copier / scanner - Australia, New Zealand
Item.Review:
I couldn't be happier with this economy priced wireless printer!
The set-up was straight forward and fast. Best of all, the printer does everything it's supposed to do. It prints from every device on my network, it scans, and it copies. Of course, it requires a power cord to the wall but there are no other cables of any sort. I can print directly from my desktop computer, my iPad, laptop computer, or any other device that can connect to my home wi-fi network with no fuss or complications.
The print quality is average. Sometimes the colors are a little bit pale compared to printers with more color cartridges, but you wouldn't know that if you didn't have older copies of the same document to compare the new ones to. The printing speed seems fast enough to keep most owners happy ... , especially for the price.
I haven't had the printer long enough to know how long the ink cartridges last, but Costco has the large replacement cartridges for a reasonable price.
In a perfect world, this machine might have a FAX and be able to send a scan to a device other than my desktop computer or to an e-mail address, but HP makes higher priced printers that address those issues.
The quality is at least average and the price was low. I count this as a great value printer. There are better printers out there, but not for this price. I love it. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: HP Photosmart Premium C310a e-All-in-One Color Ink-jet - Printer / copier / scanner - Australia, New Zealand
Item.Review:
In researching printers to replace my old HP which died (good life), I found this All-in-One Printer to have everything I wanted, but I was reluctant to purchase it because of some pretty negative reviews. The primary issue in these reviews was that the printer would not become activated after it had been in the "sleep" mode for a while. There seemed to be a lot of reviews stating this problem and the resulting lack of assistance from HP in correcting it. I brought this up to the staff person I dealt with when I bought this at an Office Depot store. I asked whether they had sold a lot of these (yes) and whether he knew of any that had been returned because of this issue (no). He said that there likely would be more issues discussed on-line regarding HP printers compared to other brands bec ... ause there are a lot more HP printers in use. Given Office Depots 30 day return policy and armed with an extended service plan (very reasonable price) and the great deal I got (the printer was on sale at that time), I purchased my HP All-in-one.
The wireless setup was very easy, and in short order I was printing. The quality of the photos I printed was excellent. The text quality was good, but not as good as with my old HP. However, I think text printing quality would easily meet most users' needs. When the printer went into sleep mode it would be easily reactivated when I printed something from the computer. However, if I wanted to activate it to use the touch screen, I did not know how to do this without printing something from the computer. My one knock on this HP is that the brief user directions pamphlet did not discuss how to use the touch screen from the sleep mode. After some experimenting with it, I figured out that the printer would become active from sleep mode by either tapping the touch screen several times in succession or pushing the power button. This process would have been easier it this had been addressed in the user guide.
I have had my HP for one month as of ... expand » « collapse

Item.Item: HP Photosmart Premium C310a e-All-in-One Color Ink-jet - Printer / copier / scanner - Australia, New Zealand
Item.Review: After eight years owning a Canon printer, I was amazed at what today's printers can do! The best feature is the automatic two sided coping, saves me a boat load of paper. Photos are fantastic, but I wouldn't want to make many at the cost of ink. Overall a very good printer, fast setup, WiFi does away with cords, and the small foot print make it easy to place in tight places.

Item.Item: HP Photosmart Premium C310a e-All-in-One Color Ink-jet - Printer / copier / scanner - Australia, New Zealand
Item.Review:
Pros: The features and the ability to print from an iPad
Cons: Nothing
I bought this printer to replace an HP we had had for YEARS and YEARS. For the price, it is a printer that has numerous useful features. What I like best is it is completely wireless. It was extremely easy to set up. It also allows me to flawlessly print from my iPad. And it is fast. Photos print out great. I would definitely recommend this printer to anyone (even a novice). The touch panel offers connections to various websites where you can print color pages for the kids or coupons for shopping. Pretty cool!!

Item.Item: HP Photosmart Premium C310a e-All-in-One Color Ink-jet - Printer / copier / scanner - Australia, New Zealand
Item.Review:
Pros: easy to use, good price, good color.
Cons: doesn't hold much paper.
Picture quality is great. Easy use, and easy to set up, and the ink is more affordable than my Epson. Things I would like to change would be the paper tray could hold more. It is a little noisy, but so was my last printer. It does a nice job, so I am not unhappy with my purchase.

Item.Item: HP Photosmart Premium C310a e-All-in-One Color Ink-jet - Printer / copier / scanner - Australia, New Zealand
Item.Review:
Pros: features & Price
Cons: no Auto Document Feeder for the scanner
My Brother MFC broke last night after 2 years of little use. My wife and I have iPhones and I wanted to see what HP was offering with the built in print function of iOS 4.2. I was happy to find this printer. I went to the store and was trying to decide between this one and the next one up (w/fax) they both were on sale and only $50 separated the two. I don't use fax much anymore and they both do double sided printing. The selling point were the web apps for children and this one was $50 less.
Got it home and printed from my iPhone in about 10 minutes. Installed on my mac and printed right after completion. I tested the "eprint" service through HP and the email printed in about 3 minutes from being ... sent.
so far so good. If any performance changes I will update this post. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: HP Photosmart Premium C310a e-All-in-One Color Ink-jet - Printer / copier / scanner - Australia, New Zealand
Item.Review:
Pros: Easy to setup, good price, and quality and wireless!
Cons: I did not get the e-print feature setup easily but it's not that important
I needed a wireless printer for my 2 laptops to be able to print with ease. This was easy to install and I love being able to print borderless photos!

Item.Item: HP Photosmart Premium C310a e-All-in-One Color Ink-jet - Printer / copier / scanner - Australia, New Zealand
Item.Review: i recommend this printer. To print wireless is incredible. directly from laptop and even my iphone so easily. The colors are amazing. Photo printing is absolutely picture perfect. Oh and the kids love being able to print out coloring pages. The reviews only let me give a 5 out of 5 but should be a 10 out of 5.

Item.Item: HP Photosmart Premium C310a e-All-in-One Color Ink-jet - Printer / copier / scanner - Australia, New Zealand
Item.Review: WOW was the first word that came out of my mouth for this printer. Now that I have used just about every feature on the printer I gladly would have paid another 100-150.00 for it. To print wireless is incredible. directly from laptop and even my iphone so easily. The colors are amazing. Photo printing is absolutely picture perfect. Oh and the kids love being able to print out coloring pages. The reviews only let me give a 5 out of 5 but should be a 10 out of 5. i love this printer

Item.Item: HP Photosmart Premium C310a e-All-in-One Color Ink-jet - Printer / copier / scanner - Australia, New Zealand
Item.Review:
The purchase price was very reasonable but that is how they hook you. In July I installed all new print cartridges, setting the printer to default print in grayscale. We may have printed 100 sheets since then. Printed nothing in color.
Today I had to purchase all colors and black again. I purchased the cartridges at a local big box discount store - all three colors for $50 and three black cartridges for $60. This is an unbelievable cost for ink for a printer getting this little use.
Buy another printer if you don't want to spend $250 a year for ink!

Item.Item: HP Photosmart Premium C310a e-All-in-One Color Ink-jet - Printer / copier / scanner - Australia, New Zealand
Item.ReviewTitle: One of the most problematic printers!
Item.Review:
On an average this printer worked only for 3 months for me. The problems with this printer are abound and severely limits one's productivity (thanks to the time-consuming hard-to-fix problems). Overall, the print quality is okay; however, for the price, it could be better. The touch controls on the printer screen are not very convenient, very difficult to navigate through the menu. For example, the scroll feature does not work quite well; instead of scrolling through the list, it activates the selection at the first point of contact. Moreover, the menu are not designed well enough. For example, Network Test automatically prints out a page instead of just displaying the results on the screening.. (which leads to unwanted printouts, thus wastage of paper)
The hinges of the copy/scan b ... oard over the printer are fickle prone to breakages. I had to replace my printer.
The worst part- It has several problems with wireless printing capability... Disruption of wireless connection is frequent between the printer and the wireless router.. call it time-out or what not.. One is forced to restart the printer more often than not.
Latest in the list of woes with this printer: After working fine for a few days, the wireless setup wizard fails to identify the wireless router in spite of manually entering the name of SSID! My laptops simply work fine through the wireless router. This was a major time-consuming issue with both the previous and the present HP photosmart premium C310a printer. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: HP Photosmart Premium C310a e-All-in-One Color Ink-jet - Printer / copier / scanner - Australia, New Zealand
Item.Review: I've had my printer for about a year now. I love the fast copy & print speeds. The photos are so realistic they look like they came from a photo lab. My brother was so impressed he bought one too!

Item.Item: HP Photosmart Premium C310a e-All-in-One Color Ink-jet - Printer / copier / scanner - Australia, New Zealand
Item.ReviewTitle: It works better than I expected for the price.
Item.Review:
Pros: Easy to set up
Cons: Everything is working great.
The printer was easy to set (just follow directions) and it works from two different PC's on my network just like I hoped for. I would recommend it. I bought it on sale at about $50 less than list price.

Item.Item: HP Photosmart Premium C310a e-All-in-One Color Ink-jet - Printer / copier / scanner - Australia, New Zealand
Item.Review: This all in one printer replaces my older Dell A940 all in one. The speed of the new printer is quite amazing . The scanning and picture quality is 100% better along with ease of use. The touch screen is nice and easy to use once you get the hang of it. The only problem I've encountered is the fact that I can't boot my computer unless the printer is powered off, otherwise I would reccommend it to any one.

Item.Item: HP Photosmart Premium C310a e-All-in-One Color Ink-jet - Printer / copier / scanner - Australia, New Zealand
Item.Review:
Pros: Great print quality on photos. Awesome features.
Cons: Print speed is a little slow, but not painful by any means.
Love, love, love this printer! The remote scanning feature is nice as well. I also like the fact it has a seperate tray for photo paper which means I can load it about once a month and never have to switch out paper all the time like I did with my old one. Wireless feature works flawlessly. I coudn't be happier with this purchase!

Item.Item: HP Photosmart Premium C310a e-All-in-One Color Ink-jet - Printer / copier / scanner - Australia, New Zealand
Item.Review:
Pros: Excellent Features, Easy Setup, Fairly Priced
This printer set up in very little time and with ease using the provided software. It also works great on Mac or PC. Only glitch so far, if left on for a few days straight, my iPhone 4 won't be able to find it on the network to print. Usually turning the printer off and back on fixes this immediately. Photo printing with this device is amazing. I can snap a shot with my iPhone and send it directly to the printer. I love the borderless printing and the color is great. I would recommend this product to anyone looking for a solid wireless printer for their network.

Item.Item: HP Photosmart Premium C310a e-All-in-One Color Ink-jet - Printer / copier / scanner - Australia, New Zealand
Item.Review:
Pros: Replaced my older photosmart 3100 which used 5 cartridges. It only had photo black ink, so the print quality on text documents wasn't all that great. This printer has 2 black cartridges, one for photo and the other for text/graphics. Both photos and text look great! My wife and I can't tell the difference between photos printed on our old printer with the extra 2 color photo cartridges and this one with only 3 color cartridges. That's great, as the old printer didn't use the 2 photo cartridges much except for photos. So, cartridge multipacks were kind of useless as we print a lot of documents. Print speed is extremely fast for an inkjet.
Works awesome with my wife's iPad. Also works well with Mac OS 10.7 and 10.7 and Windows XP and 7.
I have no problems with the ... WiFi. I'm running a network with WPA2 with AES on 802.11G. I use a router running dd-wrt.
Scanning works well, even with my wife's Mac. The web interface for scanning is nice to use as well instead of a nati
Cons: The setup up cartridges run out fairly quickly, but I got the printer for $88 direct from HP so I can't complain. I watch the deals at Staples for ink. Lately they've been giving $6 in rewards per cartridge when purchasing $50 or more of ink. Turning in 5 cartridges gets me $30 in rewards, so they helps offset the ink quite a bit. We purchased a nice laptop bag for my wife with rewards.
When doing copies, it doesn't seem to get things in the extreme margins. It would be nice if the copy function scaled the image down instead of chopping off the margins. In general this hasn't caused me much grief.
I would have liked an ethernet port (I like wires), but the Wifi works well, so I can't complain.
I've never had an HP printer die on me. I've used other brands, and in general I prefer HP for their quality. Their ink is expensive, but it works well. I've dealt with remanufactured products in the past which were almost worthless given their failure rate and poor quality. I extremely hate printing and dealing with printers, but when it comes to the lesser of many evils, HP printers generally do pretty well for me. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: HP Photosmart Premium C310a e-All-in-One Color Ink-jet - Printer / copier / scanner - Australia, New Zealand
Item.Review: I purchased my C310a from Costco. It installed and worked great for a few months, then after moving it to to a new location within my home office, began to have problems with remote printing from my Blackberry. Also had some problems with the photo paper feed tray. HP Support was great. My first support call didn't resolve the feed tray problem, but I worked that one out while we were on the phone. The remote printing issue however was resolved by an HP tech. She connected via the web, worked around and got it working great. A few weeks later, same problem. Couldn't log into the eprint website to change the email address to a simple-to-remember one, and ended up removing the printer from my computer. After reinstalling the software, wireless within my office was restored, but it stil ... l would not connect to the Web Services. In about 10 minutes, I had another HP Tech on the phone, who talked me through several configuration possibilities. We eventually found that the DMZ for my Router was not enabled, apparently a key issue for the Web Service. Also, the printer did not have the correct IPv4 IP addresses. An IP was not picked up via DHCP, so I manually entered the IP address and DNS addresses into the printer. Everything now worked. The Tech sounded young and appeared to be in a learning stage, but he worked well with me, showed good knowledge, and we worked out these problems. I have had nothing but good results from HP support this past year. I like everything else about this printer and prefer its scanner to the HP 4070 Scanner that I also have. The photo paper feed and two-sided functions are both far superior to the HP 6480 that I've been relying on for the past 5 or 6 years. Still use the 6480, but am finding that the C310a Ink provides more and better printing for lower cost, since you can replace individual colors. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: HP Photosmart Premium C310a e-All-in-One Color Ink-jet - Printer / copier / scanner - Australia, New Zealand
Item.ReviewTitle: Great Feature Set, but Buggy and Frustrating
Item.Review:
I bought this printer at my local Costco at a discounted $130. Initially I was happy because, as a student, I was only looking for two features: -Automatic double sided printing -Scanning
Print speed, quality, the wireless apps, etc don't matter much to me.
Here are its pros and cons:
Pros: -Wireless Printing -Automatic duplexing (double sided printing) -Great photo quality -Setup was not difficult. -Nice bells and whistles (Web apps, printing from/scanning to a memory card) -The paper holding bay is designed well. You can fit a lot of paper into the loading bay, and there is a dedicated slot for photo paper. -The default printing templates are useful. You can easily choose to print in a variety of modes depending on your desired print qua ... lity/paper usage/speed.
Cons: -Touch screen is utterly unnecessary and a pain to use. It is slow and unresponsive. -Very glitchy. The first time I turned on this printer the touchscreen locked up on a black screen. -Wireless features constantly fail. Perhaps it's just not perfectly compatible with Windows 7, but I can't get this thing to scan wirelessly at all. The printer disconnects after a while, and when that happens you need to yank out the power cord, re-plug, and re-boot. -Slow boot time -The printer software is incredibly slow. There is no reason that, on my blazing fast rig running off an SSD, the printer software should take so long to load. It takes seconds to transition between loading each menu item.
Bottom Line: Great featureset, but its constant hangs, disconnections, and errors make this otherwise excellent AIO a headache. Unless you find that it works perfectly with your OS (maybe it works flawlessly in Windows XP, Vista, or Mac OS X), there are much better printers for the price. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: HP Photosmart Premium C310a e-All-in-One Color Ink-jet - Printer / copier / scanner - Australia, New Zealand
Item.Review:
Pros: Print quality, scanning/copying capabilities, wireless hookup
Cons: Takes a bit to warm up
Prints docs and photos well and hooked up wireless with ease. Takes a min to warm up but prints quickly. Screen is nice and easy to use.

Item.Item: HP Photosmart Premium C310a e-All-in-One Color Ink-jet - Printer / copier / scanner - Australia, New Zealand
Item.Review: I am a photographer and have used HP printers along with photoshop to get very high quality prints. When my C8180 broke and was no longer available,I replaced it with this one. Photo prints are terrible with or without photoshop. Giant step backward. Poor value. I would gladly pay more to have another C8180.

Item.Item: HP Photosmart Premium C310a e-All-in-One Color Ink-jet - Printer / copier / scanner - Australia, New Zealand
Item.Review:
Pros: photo print quality, price
Cons: poor quality
I really wanted to like this printer; nice features, good print quality, nice price. But in the 3 weeks I had it, I experienced many of the same hardware complaints that others had- out of aligned print in draft mode, numerous alignment problems, error messages that said "could not align print head", HP's troubleshooting steps could not resolve. I used to really like HP, but returned the printer & will get a Canon.

Item.Item: HP Photosmart Premium C310a e-All-in-One Color Ink-jet - Printer / copier / scanner - Australia, New Zealand
Item.ReviewTitle: Junk and a waste of time
Item.Review:
Pros: Didn't last long enough to see if it had any redeeming qualities.
Cons: Poor build quality, scanner carriage design
Some kind of a record for me Was at the exchange counter within 2 hours of purchasing it. Setup was easy, printed an OK test page, scanner made it half way through the first scan before it jammed up and died. Took it back and got a Canon MG5220 which was 50 bucks cheaper and of much better quality.

Item.Item: HP Photosmart Premium C310a e-All-in-One Color Ink-jet - Printer / copier / scanner - Australia, New Zealand
Item.Review:
Have been happy HP printer user for many years. Last printer was the model C309g which was great. However, Santa brought my wife an Ipad for Christmas so we needed this upgrade to the C310a so she could print from the Ipad. Installation was super easy and it works wirelessly with all 3 PC's plus the Ipad in our home network. No problem what so ever.
While scanning may be a bit slow.....the quality of image reproduction is very high. it gets very heavy use as I am scanning many hundreds of old family photos from both sides of our family, in order to digitize them and store on DVD's and hard drives.
Color and B & W photo printing quality is excellent. I rarely use the 4 X 6 inch format.....nearly always at least 5 x 7 or 8 x 10. If a larger format version of this unit were ... available I'd buy it. My preferred photo paper is the HP Everyday Photo Paper with the semi-gloss surface. Yes, it dries more slowly than the premium and other more expensive HP photo papers. BUT it produces very noticeably sharper detail in my images than any of the other HP photo papers. AND I've tried them all. I'll accept the slower drying time in exchange for the sharpness of detail. I have everything, printer, computer and monitor calibrated to use with this paper.
One irritating feature: When I'm in a hurry to copy or print something and I have to wait while the C310a goes through a set-up cycle it drives me nuts. I wish HP would do something to speed this process up.
It prints flawlessly from my wife's Ipad. Happy wife makes for happy husband.
I would like to see the photo paper tray expandable to 8 1/2" X 11" size. Then I could keep my photo paper and plain paper in the machine all the time.
The e-print feature is fascinating but I have not found a use for it. I think it would probably be useful for a business but not really an important feature for home use.
Another superior product from HP. I've owned at least 5 or 6 over the years....all trouble free.
Thank you. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: HP Photosmart Premium C310a e-All-in-One Color Ink-jet - Printer / copier / scanner - Australia, New Zealand
Item.Review:
Pros: It makes quick B&W documents
Cons: Photo Quality is subpar. HP software is bloated and useless. An Ink Hog....
And the decline continues. I gave up on HP laptops several years ago because of quality issues, but I stuck with there printers because they where fairly inexpensive and very reliable. That has ended. I not sure where to start. The photo print quality was laughable. It is virtually impossible to turn off the printer managed colors when printing from Photoshop or Lightroom with the HP software installed. I'm experienced with printing photos, yet every single print I made came out in some bizarre hp modified color scheme. To make matters worse, after installing the HP software (mandatory if you need to use the scan function) my computer would no longer ... "sleep". The only way around this was to disconnect the printer and fully disable the HP software. Hardly convenient. A call to HP's clueless support line resulted in a diagnosis by there techs that my computer was defective. This hunk of junk was returned and I bought a Canon Pixma (same people who make my cameras) and low and behold everything works perfect and as an added bonus there is Photoshop support built into Canon software... Conclusion......Look elsewhere if you want good quality home photos.. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: HP Photosmart Premium C310a e-All-in-One Color Ink-jet - Printer / copier / scanner - Australia, New Zealand
Item.Review:
Ok, I haven't had this printer very long but I haven't had any issues with it so far. Setup was mostly easy except two of my computers had difficulty in loading the drivers. I found the solution online and was able to get them loaded without having to call tech support.
I love being able to print from my iPhone directly and it's amazing that the printer recognized when I was printing pictures from the phone and automatically selected the picture paper. My daughter likes the ability to print things directly on the printer from the internet. She printed several projects for Easter. The interface is simple and fast.
I have set all of my computers to automatically print in greyscale and double-sided to help save on paper and ink costs.Printing is fast and almost always complete b ... y the time I walk over to the printer.
Right now I would recommend this printer especially with some of the offers that are out there. I paid $79.99 for the printer after an OfficeMax discount of $70 plus they gave me $50 for the trade-in of my old printer. I have another HP printer that uses the same cartridges so I no longer have to buy different cartridges for different printers. By setting the default to greyscale and using the XL cartridges the ink usage is much better than the old Dell printer that I traded in. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: HP Photosmart Premium C310a e-All-in-One Color Ink-jet - Printer / copier / scanner - Australia, New Zealand
Item.ReviewTitle: GREAT FOR PHOTOS --- IF THE PRINT HEAD WORKED
Item.Review:
Pros: features and photo quality
Cons: cant expect it to function properly. there is some bad design going on with the print heads.
I bought two of these. the first one was fine until started printing about the 10th photo, and the print head gears were making an aweful lot of cranking noises. but the printer was operable. however I assumed something was wrong, or would go wrong because of all the noise, I thought for sure it was going to break. so I brought it back and exchanged for another. this one was broken right out of the box. the print head didnt even move when I plugged it in so I couldn't even put the ink in. it sounded like it broke itself. while powering on it just went "crank crank crank" then a huge CRANK and NOTHING. just died. right there. SO needless to say I ... returned this second printer. opted for a canon M5220, but the photo quality sucks on that one.
if you can get one of these printers in working condition ITS GREAT! expand » « collapse

Item.Item: HP Photosmart Premium C310a e-All-in-One Color Ink-jet - Printer / copier / scanner - Australia, New Zealand
Item.Review:
Pros: worthless
Cons: hard set-up, useless manual, constant trouble
Problems started the moment I took the item out of the package. Setting it up for my network took almost 2hrs on the phone with HP tech support at which point all seemed well after a test print. Tried to print a picture later that day and color was terrible. I had to clean the cartridges which helped the picture and things were find the rest of that day. I tried to print something the next day and the page was nothing but a group of blurry lines, cleaned cartridges again. Once again, all was well. Tried to print a second item and image was bad again. Tried to align the cartridges and just keep getting messages saying alignment failed. Can find no info to resolve on HP site and to say the "troubleshooting" por ... tion of the HP manual is a joke would be an understatement. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: HP Photosmart Premium C310a e-All-in-One Color Ink-jet - Printer / copier / scanner - Australia, New Zealand
Item.Review: The printer was very easy to set-up and has many great features including apps and e-mail printing. photo printing quality is excellent as well as everyday printing. I also like that the ink cartridges are seperate. This saves money in the long run and does not waste ink.

Item.Item: HP Photosmart Premium C310a e-All-in-One Color Ink-jet - Printer / copier / scanner - Australia, New Zealand
Item.ReviewTitle: Printer does not perform - too much trouble
Item.Review:
Pros: Price seemed OK......
Cons: Quality is poor. Alignment/cartridge cleaning necessary after only one picture. Too much time troubleshooting
I purchased this printer in December 2010 based on a discussion and product demonstration from an HP representative in the Best Buy store. Set the printer up in January - only one picture (an old/non-digital/scanned photo) has printed well. Picture quality has been very poor even though the originals are of good digital quality. The border on pictures is now uneven. Align printer function failed -- would not align. Ran the 'Clean Cartridge' function then ran 'Align Printer' and it said successful. Border is still off and quality is very poor - yes, I am using HP Premium Photo paper. Also wants to default to paper tray for 8 x 10 and c ... annot seem to fix that either. Way too much trouble and problems -- have only printed a total of 10 pictures - one turned out great (see previous comment) and the rest have been printed in an attempt to fix quality/border alignment issue. Cannot fix and it is frustrating and now I am stuck with a very poor printer.... Do not recommend even if it goes on sale.... expand » « collapse

Item.Item: HP Photosmart Premium C310a e-All-in-One Color Ink-jet - Printer / copier / scanner - Australia, New Zealand
Item.Review:
Pros: Look & performance
Cons: Haven't found anything "not so great" yet.
I LOVE my new HP Printer! The separate tray for 4x6 and 5x7 photo paper is an excellent idea. Makes it so much more efficient and time saving. On my old printer, I had to put two 4x6 pics on one large sheet and then cut them up by hand. I also appreciate the little gauge that comes up each time I print to let me know how much ink is left in the cartridges. And, on top of all that efficiency is the beautiful shiny black exterior....... very sleek. Thank you, HP. You haven't let me down yet!

Item.Item: HP Photosmart Premium C310a e-All-in-One Color Ink-jet - Printer / copier / scanner - Australia, New Zealand
Item.ReviewTitle: The Dr. Jekyll and Mr. Hyde Printer
Item.Review:
Pros: Beautiful glossy color prints
Cons: Problems replacing ink cartridges = memorize tech support #
If you purchase this printer you can expect to see some fantastic prints, good scans, and reasonable setup, but you BETTER be prepared for the distinct possibility of endless annoyance.
Purchased this printer about four months ago. Setup went fine and prints, especially prints on glossy photo paper, look incredible. It wasn't until it came time to change a printer cartridge that the printer showed the true colors of what you can expect from such an inexpensive printer that claims to do everything (print, scan, wireless, do your laundry).
Placed in a new set of HP cartridges and started getting error message and no function. Ended up with a call to HP tech suppor ... t. After being walked through various steps, taking out the printer head assembly, cartridges in and out, power on and off, stand up, sit down, turn around ... 45 minutes later the printer was back.
Printed and scanned just fine until this week when it was time for another set of cartridges and the SAME problem again. Another tech support call. 45 minutes ... this time they are sending a new printer head. I will update if that fixes the issue. But, if every cartridge change means a call to tech support ... its easier to toss the printer in the garbage and buy a new one every few months. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: HP Photosmart Premium C310a e-All-in-One Color Ink-jet - Printer / copier / scanner - Australia, New Zealand
Item.Review:
Pros: easy setup, good price
Cons: had to return first one, may have to return second.
Cool features in theory. just ok in practice. probably just annoyed that I had to return it once and am probably going to have to a second time. First was due to probably bad jets, printed blank or faded pages even after numerous troubleshooting attempts. Now screen doesn't seem to want to wake from sleep.

Item.Item: HP Photosmart Premium C310a e-All-in-One Color Ink-jet - Printer / copier / scanner - Australia, New Zealand
Item.Review: I have had several HP printers over the years and they just keep on working. I now upgrade for the features. This printer does a very good job at everything I have printed so far, to include photos. The colors are crisp and pictures are clear. I also love the e-print feature. I can print documents from my Ipad to it from anywhere.

Item.Item: HP Photosmart Premium C310a e-All-in-One Color Ink-jet - Printer / copier / scanner - Australia, New Zealand
Item.Review:
Pros: Easy to set up and to use.
Cons: Photo quality is good but could be better
Very easy to set up and use. Print quality & speed of printing is excellent. Ink cartridges are easy to install. Picture tray makes it easy to print photos.

Item.Item: HP Photosmart Premium C310a e-All-in-One Color Ink-jet - Printer / copier / scanner - Australia, New Zealand
Item.Review:
Pros: Print quality, ePrint, separate paper trays, and built-in wireless
Cons: Touch screen responsiveness
My wife and I purchased this printer as a Chrimstmas gift for each other. We bought it when it was on sale for $150. We upgraded from an older generation HP Photosmart printer. It prints in black and color at decent speeds. The separate photo paper tray is convenient and allows you to load photo paper and forget about it. The ePrint feature is great if you own an iOS device (iPhone, iPod touch, and/or iPad). It also features built-in wireless which is nice if you have the printer in a location which is not near a computer.
The mounted touch screen is nice but is somewhat hard to use. It is touch sensitive and does not always respond correctly. It is not a deal bre ... aker as the apps on the printer's screen almost feel like a gimmick.
Overall, I would recommend this printer to anyone looking to upgrade from a basic printer or to print from an iOS device. The added features and the print quality are great. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: HP Photosmart Premium C310a e-All-in-One Color Ink-jet - Printer / copier / scanner - Australia, New Zealand
Item.Review:
Pros: The wireless & e-print feature
Cons: Nothing so far!
I bought this printer after reading several reviews on it. This printer was replacing an old HP printer that I had had for several years. The installation process was a bit lengthy but my computer is an older one so I assume that had something to do with it. But, once installed on my computer, it worked perfectly! I was able to get the wireless feature set up and my laptop and my iPhone were both able to "find" the printer and print to it. The e-print is a really neat feature and I have found that I really enjoy using it! I do alot of communication through e-mail and it is nice that I can forward an e-mail to the printer's address and have it printed (along with any attachments on the e-mail) and ready to go when ... I get home. I don't get on my desktop very often to do things so the wireless feature was a must. The print quality is great for what I need it for (printing e-mails, school documents for my kids, and occasionally pictures). I haven't tried using any of the apps yet (haven't had the need to at this time). I thought the price was pretty reasonable considering all the featuers it comes with. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: HP Photosmart Premium C310a e-All-in-One Color Ink-jet - Printer / copier / scanner - Australia, New Zealand
Item.Review:
Pros: Easy setup.
Cons: Nothing yet.
I've owned several HP Printers and even though I had rough going with one last year that was returned. I took a chance with this one because I liked the new options as well as HP reliability. Setup up was a breeze and the photos, which I also bought this model for are clear and crisp. I like the fact that you replace each ink cartridge as it runs out. I have no complaints on this printer at all.

Item.Item: HP Photosmart Premium C310a e-All-in-One Color Ink-jet - Printer / copier / scanner - Australia, New Zealand
Item.Review:
I couldn't be happier with this printer! It does an incredible job printing all forms of documents and photos. I mainly print high resolution photos off of this machine and it does an amazing job. The ink refills are cheap and don't listen to others because the ink lasts a LONG time! People who say this printer goes through ink fast much have a little gnome drinking it while they sleep. I have printed eight 8 x 10 photos in the best quality color and my ink has only gone down about 3-4% all around. And that is with the ink that came with the machine. Which by the way is a full set of cartridges, not half filled demo's like other brands.
Overall I highly recommend this product. The features are amazing and fun. As well it has wireless with ePrint technology, so no matter where you ar ... e in the world, you just email a document or picture to the printers email address and it will print your project so it is waiting for you at home.
I have ZERO cons for this printer. HP really nailed the quality within the price range with this model. A+, Two Thumbs Up, 10/10 Recommended! expand » « collapse

Item.Item: HP Photosmart Premium C310a e-All-in-One Color Ink-jet - Printer / copier / scanner - Australia, New Zealand
Item.ReviewTitle: Good concept but not easy to setup
Item.Review:
Pros: Features
Cons: Wireless had problems
I've owned only HP printers and I have been looking at the HP Wireless printers for the last couple of weeks and was excited when this particular model went on sale. As soon as I got it home I followed all the instructions and started setting up wireless...nothing.
Rebooted my router, followed the instructions again, printed the wireless test and it kept saying that the wireless radio was not functioning. After a few hours of trying to troubleshoot, I contacted HP Support and spent about another hour going through all the same steps and they said that the printer had to be replaced due to the wireless going bad. I returned the printer the next day and Best Buy was sold out. I had hoped to exchange it but I got the HP Photosmar ... t Premium with Fax instead and paid a little more. It was so much easier to setup and the wireless connected without any problem. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: HP Photosmart Premium C310a e-All-in-One Color Ink-jet - Printer / copier / scanner - Australia, New Zealand
Item.Review:
Pros: Price and quality of the printing.
Cons: Nothing.
My husband and I absolutely love our new printer. We take and print a lot of photos and are amazed at the quality of the photos. We also like the idea of having two black cartridges - a separate one for the photos. Our other printer was always running out of the "all important" black.

Item.Item: HP Photosmart Premium C310a e-All-in-One Color Ink-jet - Printer / copier / scanner - Australia, New Zealand
Item.Review:
Pros: The printer is a standard HP -- Good output.
Cons: The software leaves much to be desired. 5 flippin' cartridges to replace.
The printer is easy to set up and prints good colors. There are five cartridges, though, so I'm starting to see dollar symbols shoot out of it every time a print job completes.
The software is garbage. It's very confusing, requires ten-billion clicks just to print a single photo, and needs constant updates. If your user account doesn't have admin privileges, the software won't even work if an update is detected. The update MUST be installed for the program to function. VERY INSTRUSIVE AND USER UNFRIENDLY.

Item.Item: HP Photosmart Premium C310a e-All-in-One Color Ink-jet - Printer / copier / scanner - Australia, New Zealand
Item.Review:
Pros: Good print quality, double sided printing
Cons: Network set-up was not as "user-friendly" as I had hoped.
I do alot of printing for my college courses. I'm able to print many more pages per ink cartrige than in my older printer. I also like the automatic two-sided printing capability.
The only negative was that the set-up on my wireless network was not as easy as I had thought it was going to be. (But I'm a little inexperienced when it comes to those matters). And loading the software to my laptop with Windows Vista proved to be impossible. I ended up only being able to download the basic software from the HP website to use on that machine.
Overall a good printer for the price. Good features, good photo print quality. Would recommend it for families needin ... g a decent printer for general homework printing and general photo printing. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: HP Photosmart Premium C310a e-All-in-One Color Ink-jet - Printer / copier / scanner - Australia, New Zealand
Item.Review:
Pros: excellent photo prints.
Cons: drinks ink. pre-packaged ink sets. very noisy and shakey.
This thing sucks ink and the ink is expensive!! And you have two (2) separate package sets of ink in order to get both blacks that you must have. Both blacks cannot be purchased in one package! And, it makes you buy a extra black which you cannot use until that particular black runs out! It will also tell you that you are very low on a color. If you remove that color and re- insert it back into the printer, it will read approx 1/2 full. I wonder why??? Print quality is good. Photo quality is excellent. Printer is exceptionally noisy and shakes very hard at times when it is re-setting! Once it starts, which can take awhile, it prints very fast in b/w. But, buying the ink will re ... quire a lot of money-for a printer!! expand » « collapse

Item.Item: HP Photosmart Premium C310a e-All-in-One Color Ink-jet - Printer / copier / scanner - Australia, New Zealand
Item.Review:
Pros: Fast; Quick Communication; Easy setup
Cons: No port for ethernet cble
I am really happy with this printer. It is quick and easy to use. The set up was a breeze, and for having a wireless connection, it prints even pictures very quickly. The only downside is no ethernet cable connection.

Item.Item: HP Photosmart Premium C310a e-All-in-One Color Ink-jet - Printer / copier / scanner - Australia, New Zealand
Item.Review:
Pros: ePrint feature
Cons: Brokeen straight out of the box
Bought a HP from Wal-Mart earlier this week for my wife. Couldn't even finish the initial setup. Got to install the color carriages, but then got a error code. Went all over the internet and finally returned it for a Canon. So today, I was at Best Buy looking at headset and happen to wonder through the computer section and a HP rep was there. Was started talking and this one was on sale. As was photo paper and a cartriage combo. So I figured I needed my own photo printer and bought it.
Get it home, start it up and right off the bat it says theres a paper jam. Paper jam? So I check to make sure I didn't leave any plastic or tape from the packing. Then it says theres a carriage jam. I haven't even installed th ... e color cartridges yet.
I restart it again and it give me this code, 0x6100004c. So I go online with HP and chat with a service rep. After 2 different styles of resets, they tell me to return it, lol. No kidding.
I really wanted the ePrint feature as I live apart from my wife and kids right now and it would have been great for them to randomly print out pics on my printer.
But two HP photos printers (different models) with the same problems, seems like a quality control issue. I will bring this back and try the same model one more time. I will set it up in-store however to ensure I don't waste more time. I hope the HP rep is there again tomorrow so we can talk... expand » « collapse

Item.Item: HP Photosmart Premium C310a e-All-in-One Color Ink-jet - Printer / copier / scanner - Australia, New Zealand
Item.Review:
Pros: Can't think of any. Gave it on egg because you can't go any lower.
Cons: First unit had poor interface with home network then mechanically broke after 4 months. HP sent a refurbish unit and would shred some pages as print. Over time, it now shreds every other page. Time to junk it and consider a better quality printer. I am the third in my family to junk this printer because of poor performance and failure.
Item.HelpfulCount: 0 out of 1 found this review helpful.

Item.Item: HP Photosmart Premium C310a e-All-in-One Color Ink-jet - Printer / copier / scanner - Australia, New Zealand
Item.Review: Setup was ok. Printing regular documents ok. Printing pictures not ok. While the printing quality is good the alignment of the pictures is off. I am using a Windows 7 laptop. Pictures print with borders on the sides and bottom and no border on the top no matter how I configure the settings. If can't resolve will return.

Item.Item: HP Photosmart Premium C310a e-All-in-One Color Ink-jet - Printer / copier / scanner - Australia, New Zealand
Item.Review: I love this Printer. It has high quality ink and prints must better than my old brother printer. The shipment was quick and hassel free. The price was okay, I wish it was a little cheaper but I think it s worth it in the long run. Definately a FIVE STAR Printer!!!!!

Item.Item: HP Photosmart Premium C310a e-All-in-One Color Ink-jet - Printer / copier / scanner - Australia, New Zealand
Item.Review:
Pros: I am throwing it away and will NEVER buy another HP printer again.
Cons: This is THE absolute biggest piece of junk I've owned. Well, next to a '74 International Scout. Expensive ink and it practically ATE it. Constant configuration issues. Tech support was worthless. And now it died.
I think I've pretty much said it all. For the 1 person out of 15 of you that is happy with their HP printer, I apologize. You'd think HP would get it.
Item.HelpfulCount: 0 out of 1 found this review helpful.

Item.Item: HP Photosmart Premium C310a e-All-in-One Color Ink-jet - Printer / copier / scanner - Australia, New Zealand
Item.Review: I would highly reccomend this printer. If you are doing high volume printing then you might want to find a different printer because you will go through a lot of printer cartridges. That is the only reason that I have the performance a 4 instead of a 5. When this item is on sale it is a steal! I really like the fact that I don t have to buy a printer cable to connect it. I can access it wirelessly

Item.Item: HP Photosmart Premium C310a e-All-in-One Color Ink-jet - Printer / copier / scanner - Australia, New Zealand
Item.Review:
Pros: interface screen
Cons: purchased in Sept 2010. burns through the ink figured it was the shipping cartridges but new ones lasted slightly longer. Prints lines in photos ink heads dried up twice. wasted tons of ink trying to get heads clean/unclogged. photo tray states out of paper half the time even when full. Wife hated the machine so much she started taking all color print jobs to print shops. Bought a Canon yesterday and tossed this on in the trash.
I had a HP7150 and HPC310 for years and both worked great but never had a good experience with this one.
Item.HelpfulCount: 0 out of 1 found this review helpful.

Item.Item: HP Photosmart Premium C310a e-All-in-One Color Ink-jet - Printer / copier / scanner - Australia, New Zealand
Item.Review: I have a big problem with printing photos, it will not pick up the 4x6 photo paper and it is all HP products. I can only put 1 or 2 sheets in at a time and then it still takes numerous tries before it works. Does anyone have an answer for this problem. P

Item.Item: HP Photosmart Premium C310a e-All-in-One Color Ink-jet - Printer / copier / scanner - Australia, New Zealand
Item.Review: I have been so disappointed with this printer. Bought 11/26/2010 as Christmas present for family. Left town day after Christmas so I didn't install until Jan. Upon setting up printer the print head was bad. Called HP and they replaced it. Now 1 year and 1 week later printhead is bad again. Guess what, no replacement part available any longer, yet they still sell this printer on HP website. WHAT???? I regularly had to turn off and unplug printer if printer had sat for a week and not been used. The job would go to printer's memory but would not print until unplugged and restarted. This printer, as other reviews indicated, uses and enormous amount of ink. No where near what HP says. Overall, a BIG disappointment from a company like HP.

Item.Item: HP Photosmart Premium C310a e-All-in-One Color Ink-jet - Printer / copier / scanner - Australia, New Zealand
Item.Review: The quality of this printer was better than I had expected. The photo printing was superb. I love the duplexing capability and the memory card input. Setup went without a hitch, wireless working great with all laptops in our home. Scanning output is excellent as well.

Item.Item: HP Photosmart Premium C310a e-All-in-One Color Ink-jet - Printer / copier / scanner - Australia, New Zealand
Item.ReviewTitle: Where HP products belong, in the trash
Item.Review: I am extremely disappointed with the printer. I received the printer as a Christmas gift exactly a year and 20 days ago. The printer was purchased approximately a month before that, give or take a few days. I began using the printer within the first week that I had received it. I used it on a semi-regular basis. I printed no more than 75 various prints. The cartridges are supposed to be able to print far more prints than 75, 500 I believe. After about 10 months, about 60 prints, all of my ink levels were very low. After running my black ink until my prints were barely legible, I decided to replace the cartridge. I replaced only the main black cartridge because I did not print in color often. I replaced the cartridge exactly as I had initially installed the first ones I had used. I pr ... inted about 2 - 5 prints when the error message "incompatible printerhead" appeared. I believed 'printerhead' was the ink cartridge, so I purchased another ink cartridge paying special attention to whether or not I had purchased the correct cartridge, I had. I installed the second cartridge and then the error message "incompatible printerhead" appeared again. My warranty was supposedly up 120 days prior to the day I had called, the printer was purchased in November 2010, then it was registered and used for the first time in December 2010, which would of made it completely impossible for the 1 year warranty to be expired by 120 days, as it is currently January 2012. Regardless, it was expired. After many attempts to repair the printer as directed, I was offered a refurbished version for very slightly less then what I could buy a new one for, I declined. The "printerhead", as you may not know, refers to the basic black strip in the shape of a square that encases the printer cartridges, on it are the symbols that show you which ink cartridge to install in which spot. I would have no clue how to remove such a thing unless directed to do so, even then it was difficult to understand how to rem ... expand » « collapse

Item.Item: HP Photosmart Premium C310a e-All-in-One Color Ink-jet - Printer / copier / scanner - Australia, New Zealand
Item.Review: Printer is easy to set up, and easy to use. It prints great photos. I like the touch screen, but having games on it seems odd. But then, I don't play games on my phone either. I have only used the print function on it so far, but that is mainly what it is going to be used for. Very happy with this purchase.

Item.Item: HP Photosmart Premium C310a e-All-in-One Color Ink-jet - Printer / copier / scanner - Australia, New Zealand
Item.Review: Easy to install, connected wirelessly with no difficulty, prints beautifully! The photographs look as though they were professionally printed. I am very pleased with this printer. And my granddaughters love the option of printing coloring book pages directly from the touch screen control on the printer.

Item.Item: HP Photosmart Premium C310a e-All-in-One Color Ink-jet - Printer / copier / scanner - Australia, New Zealand
Item.Review: This printer was a replacement of a Kodak which is still working. I replaced it with this printer because: 1) I got an iPad2 in May and do not like the inconvenience of using my desk top (as slow as molasses in January) to print; 2) the price of this HP printer was fantastic! I didn't even pay attention to the HP doubled sided printing feature when shopping and was totally surprised when the first document I printed from my iPad2 was two pages and this printer did a SUPERB job with the document. Print quality surpasses the Kodak (document and photo)!

Item.Item: HP Photosmart Premium C310a e-All-in-One Color Ink-jet - Printer / copier / scanner - Australia, New Zealand
Item.Review: I have had the C130a for about 3 months now, and apart from having to replace the black cartridge, the printer has performed exactly as expected. The household is all Apple products, and it has been so simple to print from either a MacBook, iPad or iPhone.

Item.Item: HP Photosmart Premium C310a e-All-in-One Color Ink-jet - Printer / copier / scanner - Australia, New Zealand
Item.Review: This C310a replaced a 3210 Photosmart that I had for years, and I mean years. It still prints black and white, scans, copies, and transfers photos from readers or camera, but I needed the color for photos that were beautiful on the 3210. I spoke with HP and eventually bought this C310a. The colors are brilliant and I couldn't be happier. It adds the Web to my options also.

Item.Item: HP Photosmart Premium C310a e-All-in-One Color Ink-jet - Printer / copier / scanner - Australia, New Zealand
Item.Review: Print hundreds of 600 dpi photos on HP Premium Plus per month, w/Spyder Colorimeter, Serif, Picasa, and Olympus Raw software. No mechanical, electrical, or other pros. The Photo tray fits weakly but HP's often do: I used PhotoSmart 1100's, 7560 (wow!), etc. in last 10 years to do semi-pro pix and some text. Scan is decent, too. Ink-use is BETTER than older HP's and ink cost (on sale at Staples) actually LOWER and LOWER per 8x10! Software from HP is decent but slim. I am uncertain why so many users are unhappy. Consistency? I think that is very scary, otoh Consumer Reports places this among about 10 all-in-ones they recommend: they rate ink cost a plus,speed good, resolution "very good". I would like to comment on the web/wi-fi service, but have had no reason to use them. Very good prints a ... t a low ink cost sold me, and still do. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: HP Photosmart Premium C310a e-All-in-One Color Ink-jet - Printer / copier / scanner - Australia, New Zealand
Item.Review:
Pros: Front-loading paper, good features
Cons: Setup is bit tricky.
Setup was rather tricky. Loading paper requires a little practice to get it right. But once I had the printer up and running, it was fine. Once you get used to it, loading paper from the front is a lot easier than doing it in the back. I also like the ease of creating and saving special settings for certain jobs. The scanner is good, too. Warning: If using a USB cable, do NOT connect it until after loading the software. It will instruct you when it's time to connect it.

Item.Item: HP Photosmart Premium C310a e-All-in-One Color Ink-jet - Printer / copier / scanner - Australia, New Zealand
Item.Review:
Pros: Speed
Cons: Nothing yet
I've had the printer a short time but have used it with both a MAC and Windows computer. I seems to work like the material says it should. The wi-fi connection works very well. No complaints yet! A great printer for the price.

Item.Item: HP Photosmart Premium C310a e-All-in-One Color Ink-jet - Printer / copier / scanner - Australia, New Zealand
Item.Review:
Pros: Printing quality, features & speed
I love this printer! Has some very nice features! Though I dont use the majority of them, its good to know I always can! Print quality is great! Very clear pictures! The speed is nice! Have no bad review about this product!

Item.Item: HP Photosmart Premium C310a e-All-in-One Color Ink-jet - Printer / copier / scanner - Australia, New Zealand
Item.Review:
Pros: Print quality is good.
Cons: The printer came with new ink cartridges. I purchased the printer in June 2011. All inks, except the black photo ink is empty. I have printed a total of 174 pages (29 photo 4x6 and 145 plain paper pages, all text, no images). The pages are printing pretty much blank but there is a full black photo cartridge. It seems that I will need to get new cartridges before I can print again. I feel that the ink ran out way too fast, especially when compared to my HP Photosmart 8200 (which still prints great but the cartridges are now $60!)
On another note, be sure to set up with a static IP address, or anytime you turn off the printer or lose internet connectivity, the IP address will reset and you won't be able to print until you update the IP address ... on your wireless network. expand » « collapse
Item.HelpfulCount: 0 out of 1 found this review helpful.

Item.Item: HP Photosmart Premium C310a e-All-in-One Color Ink-jet - Printer / copier / scanner - Australia, New Zealand
Item.Review:
Pros: Easy set-up, wireless, quick, scan quality, two sided printing
Cons: The bad reviews it has gotten!
I had read everyone's reviews on this printer and almost did not buy it. I had purchased the HP D110 for my son and for a simple wireless printer, it performs great and was really easy to set-up wirelessly. It was extremely easy to set-up and I had it connected wirelessly in no time. It even has the capability to show you in its touch screen what you need to do...that's cool! The Best Buy rep stated that you needed to use a USB/A cable to initially install the printer to my computer, but that was not true. I did it all wirelessly in a very short period of time. It prints great....scans well...exactly what I wanted! Don't always believe what you read.

Item.Item: HP Photosmart Premium C310a e-All-in-One Color Ink-jet - Printer / copier / scanner - Australia, New Zealand
Item.Review: I purchased this printer @ my local Costco for under $130. After reviewing the installation procedures I had it ALL setup in 20 minutes. WiFi, and network printing features included. My girlfriend & I can wirelessly print from our 2 MacBook Pro's, our 27" iMac, 2 iPod Touch's, 2 iPhone 4's and our Playstation 3 all via our home network using a Netgear N750 router. Setup was a breeze connecting all of these devices, but one does need to read & UNDERSTAND the installation procedure. Not sure why there are so many negative reviews on this printer, but we think it's a great addition to our network.

Item.Item: HP Photosmart Premium C310a e-All-in-One Color Ink-jet - Printer / copier / scanner - Australia, New Zealand
Item.Review: I am very pleased with my new HP Photosmart Premium C310. It was easy to set up. The wireless connection was a breeze. It is very quiet, as compared to my previous HP printer. Very happy with the purchase!

Item.Item: HP Photosmart Premium C310a e-All-in-One Color Ink-jet - Printer / copier / scanner - Australia, New Zealand
Item.Review:
Pros: Duplexing
Cons: Nothing
I needed a good photo printer but did not want/need the fax option. This printer fit the bill perfectly! An added bonus was the duplexing feature which saves printing that annoying second page with only one or two lines on on it!

Item.Item: HP Photosmart Premium C310a e-All-in-One Color Ink-jet - Printer / copier / scanner - Australia, New Zealand
Item.Review: i was really worried when i read the reviews but went with my gut. others say it had a connection problem mine works great. i went print happy when i first got it and only had to replace the blue at the end of the month. i love my printer. sometimes it freezes when i send to many jobs to it at once but thats fine. im patent. the noise is minimal. you should expect some sound it is a machine after all. it has great apps. my kids love it to. they can print out coloring pages whenever they want. the photo quality is great. defiantly store quality. that is as long as the photo has great pixel quality. i have scanned things on this and the pictures had great resolution. set up was easy. it took like 10 min for each machine. i now have 4 machines connected to my printer and they all have no prob ... lems. the eprint is good. love the fact that i can choose who sends things to my printer and love it even more that my friends in another state can send me an eprint if they cant get ahold of me. over all i five this product a 5 out of 5. my suggestion is this, go with your gut. there are going to be problems with any product you buy, be patient and you will find you have a great product. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: HP Photosmart Premium C310a e-All-in-One Color Ink-jet - Printer / copier / scanner - Australia, New Zealand
Item.ReviewTitle: They have some bugs to work out
Item.Review: They have a firmware problem so that the printer goes into quiet mode one or more times per day and you need to unplug the printer to restore service. HP claims they are working on the problem but if they don't correct it in the next 7-10 days the printer will be going back to Best Buy for a more reliable replacement.

Item.Item: HP Photosmart Premium C310a e-All-in-One Color Ink-jet - Printer / copier / scanner - Australia, New Zealand
Item.ReviewTitle: May be worth it at Newegg's Promo Price
Item.Review:
Pros: good looking copies, decent photos
Cons: wireless and tablet functions only work intermittently
I received this printer from HP as a low cost($199??) replacement for my Photosmart C7180 that had died just beyond the warranty period. It seemed they were pretty accustomed to doing this. In retrospect, I should have held out for a cheaper/less complex model. The concept of this printer is just too ambitious- tries to do too many things and fails at most of them.
1. It does make good copies; prints faster than 7180 (of course anything would); duplex function works on regular speed but not in economy mode-copies fly out too fast to be duplexed) 2. It comes with a removable tablet, a Zine, which you theoretically use in place of most buttons and switches. Unfor ... tunately, if it doesn't feel like working that day, it makes a simple job like making copies into a chore. 3. Setup is tricky because of inadequate documentation: if you don't know about how to get a keyboard to work on a tablet (for setting up a wireless connection), I suspect you'll be stumped about the setup. 4. Sc expand » « collapse

Item.Item: HP Photosmart Premium C310a e-All-in-One Color Ink-jet - Printer / copier / scanner - Australia, New Zealand
Item.Review:
I've had this printer for about 10 days now. Setup was a piece of cake. I don't know why people are complaining about the wireless setup. It was easy and painless. Photo printing is excellent. Double sided printing works flawlessly. It's neat that I can sit in the living room and the printer is in the study and print wirelessly.
Some reviewer complain about it running out of ink quickly. They should buy the XL cartridges and ink will last much longer. I also like that there is a different black for photos then documents. So I bought the XL black cartridge for document printing and the regular black cartridge for photos. Since I print more email and documents then photos. Also, the ink cartridges you get when you buy the printer are just to get you started. The ones you buy later hav ... e more ink in them. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: HP Photosmart Premium C310a e-All-in-One Color Ink-jet - Printer / copier / scanner - Australia, New Zealand
Item.Review: I bought the HP photosmart C310 in October 2010. set up was easy and it worked wonderfully. photos are crisp and well done. but.... January 2011, print head failure. replacement print head sent. March 2011, print head failure. replacement print head sent. April 2011 , printer failure. replacement printer sent. June 2011, printer failure. replacement printer sent. July 2011, printer failure. psychotic break ensued.. and HP is sending me an entirely different printer.

Item.Item: HP Photosmart Premium C310a e-All-in-One Color Ink-jet - Printer / copier / scanner - Australia, New Zealand
Item.Review:
Pros: Price, value, quality for normal expectations
Cons: Touch screen, warm up time to print is slow
I have only had the printer for about 3 weeks now and i love that it is wireless. I am a new father with a 6 week old son and bought this printer to do my own printing rather then paying to have it done elsewhere. I have an Asus desktop running Windows 7 and set-up was a breeze with zero complications. FOLLOW the directions and RUN installation CD FIRST. I was going back and forth on this printer with the mixed reviews. I haven't done enough printing to comment on ink usage, but so far it is fine. I will say that people have complained about the ink that comes with the printer. The cartridges that come with the printer are designed for only a few prints (I'm guessing a cost c ... utting tactic by HP because they are not full like a standard cartridge). So do not get mad because the cartridges do not last long. I would recommend buying a set of cartridges when you buy the printer to save a trip back to the store. For an average person wanting great quality photos this printer meets that need. You are NOT paying for a professional grade photo printer but compares to a print kiosk found in most department stores and pharmacies. The first 5 photos or so came out rough until the print head and ink cartridges went through their first use. After the initial prints it has been working exceptional (considering money paid for this printer). Others have commented on noise which i feel is normal. It is not silent but nothing louder then any other printer. The noisiest point is when the printer is prepping for its' print job, while the actual printing takes place it's like a whisper it is so quiet. The prep time before it starts to print does take about a minute to warm-up but the actual print time is fairly quick. The time mentioned on the box and BB website is right on. Previously had a Lexmark X8350 All-in-one, not used for photo printing, that my wife and I used for everyday printing, scanning and copying. The first time my wife used our new HP Photosmart Premium she fell in love ... expand » « collapse

Item.Item: HP Photosmart Premium C310a e-All-in-One Color Ink-jet - Printer / copier / scanner - Australia, New Zealand
Item.Review:
Pros: Easily set up and decent price
Cons: touch screen extremely sensitive if you don't have callused hands
I read a lot of negative reviews and some good ones before finally deciding I was going to take a chance on this printer and I am impressed! The apps are pretty cool and the fact that I can print from my phone or ipad is awesome. I saw that a lot of people had problems with the set up on this printer and if you follow the directions it shouldn't be difficult in any way. Of the first 4 pictures we printed two of them were great and the other two you could see lines on, they were either too bright or too dull but I am considering that just part of the set up process. Like I said the other two turned out perfect. I would definitely suggest this printer to anyone and the b ... est picture I printed was actually on Kodak Ultra Premium photo paper. It is pretty fast but a little loud and it makes a ton of noise when you initially turn it on so don't be alarmed its just "stretching out." expand » « collapse

Item.Item: HP Photosmart Premium C310a e-All-in-One Color Ink-jet - Printer / copier / scanner - Australia, New Zealand
Item.Review: I absolutely love this printer! I'm in the advertising business so we do alot of graphic design stuff so my print quality has to be good. I read one review about the cost of the cartridges.....I don't know where he gets them from, but I buy mine through office depot and they are about half of what he stated. It's a great printer!

Item.Item: HP Photosmart Premium C310a e-All-in-One Color Ink-jet - Printer / copier / scanner - Australia, New Zealand
Item.Review:
Pros: great price and easy to use
I used the Epson printer and it was not as easy to use and the ink was outrageous in the prices . This HP is so much more reasonable. The way the printer has the ink dry before you even get the paper from the printer. The colors on the pics are amazing i have never seen so much clarity and colors so bright.

Item.Item: HP Photosmart Premium C310a e-All-in-One Color Ink-jet - Printer / copier / scanner - Australia, New Zealand
Item.ReviewTitle: Do not do business with HP!!!
Item.Review:
Pros: Nothing
Cons: Product, customer service and support
Do not do business with HP!!! Purchased a new HP Photosmart Wireless e-ALL-IN-ONE C310 Series. When I opened the box, the ink cartridges that were supposed to be included were NOT in the box. I called HP (45-minute phone call), they said they would send the missing cartridges. When I received the cartridges, there were only 4 cartridges, not 5. Called HP (another 45 minute phone call), they said they would ship the 5th cartridge. When I asked if it would be possible to ship Next Day, they said they would have to charge me. After I explained how I have already been inconvenient, they agreed to ship Next Day. Well, 2 business days later, I finally received the 5th cartridge. I installed ink cartridges and error message. ... Called HP, after I explained the situation for the 3rd time, the man without telling me he was going to put me on hold, placed me on hold for 23 MINUTES before he finally came back on the phone. By then I was already on another phone trying to speak to a Supervisor. The Supervisor told me that either the ink cartridges were damaged or the printer itself is damaged. Told me that he is going to send me a return label for the printer and they would send me a refund check. 8 days later, no return label. I called and spoke to a Case Manager, and they told me that they don’t issue refund checks that the best they can do is replace with a REFURBISHED printer.
